definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: MCT includes its mark-up in the price it quotes to you.
sentences.chinese: MCT在其對您的報價中已經包括了其加價的部分。

sentences.english: The different part has a different price, boneless prime rib is also a good choose for you.
sentences.chinese: 不同部位有不同加價，無骨的上肋都是一個好的選擇。

sentences.english: He called the surcharges very high for such coverage.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，對於這類擔保來說，保費加價太高了。

sentences.english: Responsible for the collection work with price water rate above the plan.
sentences.chinese: 負責超計劃加價水費的徵收工作。

sentences.english: Bus companies such as Kowloon Motor Bus show no signs of preparing to lift fares.
sentences.chinese: 巴士公司如九巴並無加價跡象。

sentences.english: He bought a Rubens and flipped it at a markup.
sentences.chinese: 他購買了一幅魯賓斯的作品，然後轉手加價。

sentences.english: Knowing the markdown policies of the store help hagglers save money.
sentences.chinese: 弄清商店的加價規律，可以幫砍家省很多錢。

sentences.english: Now, that just leaves the wholesalers' and retailers' mark-ups .
sentences.chinese: 現在，剩下的就是批發商和零售商的加價。

definition: to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to quote a price/seller's first offer
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
complaint/to complain/to register a complaint (esp. as a customer)
